Transfection by electroporation with the MaxCyte STX transfection system**
This protocol describes 1x electroporation \(EPO) for adherent cells \(HeLa S3 & HCT116).
To identify if a cell line has an INF response
Compare cells electroporated with DNA to cells mock electroporated without DNA.
Prepare 5x10<sup>6</sup> cells per electroporation for the day of transfection in square plates.
Scale up or down the cell number according to the number of EPOs you want to perform.
• Add 8 ml 1xTrypsin to the cells to
• Incubate cells at 37°C until they completely detach
• Add 12 ml Medium to the cells, re
Collect them in a 15 ml or 50 ml Falcon tube depending on the number of EPOs
Pellet once in 5 ml Electroporation \(EPO) buffer
Add ~ 50% of the final volume of EPO buffer to the cells \(you need to reach a final volume of 100 µl at the end,
Mix of the Renilla and pBluescript plasmids, 1:10 ratio to reach a total of 20 µg, Renilla 2 µg : pbluescript 18 µg
Add them to the plasmid DNA
Mix \(be careful not to introduce air bubbles)
• \(Plasmid concentration should be > 1 µg/µl for all used plasmids)
For the control samples do not
• Measure volume of cells after addition of the plasmid DNA,
Fill up with EPO buffer to a total of 100 µl
• Add 100 µl of the cell suspension into 1x OC100 MaxCyte cuvette and use default settings for electroporation \(e.g.
Hela or HCT-116) or Optimization protocols for cell lines if no pre-set protocol is available \(test before, which optimization protocol fits best for your cell line).
• Transfer the 100 µl of cell suspension immediately to a 1x75 pre-warmed flask without adding medium \(cells re
Cover without the addition of any medium)
• Add an appropriate amount of pre-warmed medium without antibiotics to the cells, re
Plate at 1x10<sup>6</sup> cells per well in a pre-warmed 6-well plate.
• Harvest the cells 6h after addition of media
Harvest the medium of the cells \(20% of cells are still not fully attached to the plates) in a 15ml Falcon tube
Incubate at 37°C until the cells fully detach, then
RNA isolation with RNeasy Mini Kit \(Qiagen, Cat No. 74104)
Suspend the cells in 350µl RLT + 1% β-Mercaptoethanol \(Cat No. 63689)
• Transfer lysate to Qiashredder column \(Cat No. 79654),
Spin for 2 min at max speed
• Transfer max 700 µl lysate to RNeasy mini column,
• Wash column with 500 µl RPE \(2 min, 10,000xg),
• Place column into new collection tube,
Spin for 1 min at full speed
• Elute into new 1.5ml tube with 50 µl RNase free H2O
Ambion rDNase I treatment \(Cat No. AM1906)**

Fill up with H2O to 20 µl

ACTB or TUBB) using the delta Ct method described in: Livak, K. J. & Schmittgen, T. D. Analysis of relative gene expression data using real-time quantitative PCR and the 2-\[Delta]\[Delta] CT method.
